title: Are there any free alternatives to Fruity Loops? - Quora

response.answer_text: As previously mentioned, Splice is giving Ableton Live Lite for free until the end of this year. While the workflow is quite different from FL, I personally love it. With that being said, the Anonymous answer is correct, LMMS is an open source version of FL Studio. It mirrors many of the workflows of FL, and features a similar UI to FL. Your best bet is to go for LMMS.

A Daw(Digital Audio Workstation) is very important because is the hub of your studio and the DAWs have channels, returns, sends, volume, plugins, etc etc but each DAW has its unique way of organizing and communicating between the diverse elements of a music project you have a lot of options(Ableton live, logic pro, fl studio, Cubase, PreSonus studio one, studio reason, Cakewalk(free), pro tools, etc) first go for the free trials and see how it works but you have to test and work consistently to decide which one works for you and create a workflow that allows creating your music. I suggest you Ableton Live 10 an easy, fast, and flexible software for music creation and performance and you can try it for 90 days The most important is that you develop a workflow for the creation of music no matter the DAW you choose
Try industry standard amongst many professionals - Ableton Live 10 Lite over at Splice. Live 10 Lite by Ableton - Plugins (VST, AU) | Splice
